Question
========
```{r, echo = FALSE, include = FALSE}
library(readr)
boys_def <- read_csv2(
  file       = "data/boys_eu.csv",
  col_select = -(6:8),
  col_types  = cols(
    reg         = col_factor(),
  )
)
```

We want to load the semicolon-separated file `boys_eu` in the directory data, so we use the function `read_csv2()`. Fill the void the code to get the tibble below:

read_csv2(
  file       = "data/boys_eu.csv",
  col_select = -(6:8),
  col_types  = cols(
    ____________________
  )
)



```{r, echo=FALSE}
head(boys_def)
```



Solution
========
We have to specify that the variable reg is a factor variable, and we can do so using `reg = col_factor()`
